abstracts.cdata!:
Most of Bangladesh is a low-lying
            alluvial plain subject to flooding from both heavy monsoon
            rainfall and snow-melt surges of two of the world's
            largest rivers, the Brahmaputra and the Ganges. Two
            unusually severe floods occurred in 1987 and 1988. The aim
            of the Third Flood Rehabilitation (Emergency) Project is to
            restore priority infrastructure damaged by flooding so as to
            promote efficient operation of the economy. It also aims to
            ensure appropriate design and location of works and
            equipment to minimize the risk of damage or loss arising
            from future floods. The project consists of: (i)
            rehabilitation of irrigation, drainage and flood protection
            works; (ii) rehabilitation of roads and associated
            structures; (iii) repair and some reconstruction of primary
            schools; (iv) repair of inland water transport facilities;
            (v) repair of telecommunications facilities; (vi)
            rehabilitation of urban infrastructure; and (vii) provision
            of technical services by local and foreign consultants.
